summary: This is an AT&T International Call Detail Record (ICDR) report, run on June 17, 2020, showing voice usage records for a specific matter from March 1, 2020, to June 15, 2020. The report lists 37 call attempts, primarily between numbers in the USA and the UK, with most calls unanswered.

events.title: Series of call attempts from USA to UK
events.description: Nine consecutive call attempts were made from a US number to a UK number within a minute, all unanswered.

events.title: Series of call attempts from USA to UK
events.description: Six consecutive call attempts were made from a US number to a UK number, with the final two showing 'FromCPN' as 'Yes'.

events.title: Connected call from USA to UK
events.description: A call from a US number to a UK number connected for 4 minutes and 40 seconds, with 'FromCPN' indicated as 'Yes'.

events.title: Connected call from USA to UK
events.description: A call from a US number to a UK number connected for 7 minutes and 34 seconds.

events.title: Multiple call attempts and connections
events.description: Several call attempts were made from a US number to a UK number, with three connected calls lasting 24 seconds, 56 seconds, and 3 minutes 11 seconds.

events.title: Long connected call from USA to UK
events.description: A call from a US number to a UK number connected for 15 minutes and 53 seconds.

keyFacts: The document is an AT&T International Call Detail Record (ICDR) report related to Matter ID 2996479.
The report covers call activity from March 1, 2020, to June 15, 2020, and was run on June 17, 2020.
It details 37 call records, showing repeated attempts from US phone numbers to UK phone numbers.
Many calls were unanswered (AnswerInd: No), but several connected calls lasted from seconds to over 15 minutes.
The data indicates persistent telephonic contact between parties in the USA and the UK during the specified period, likely as part of an investigation.
